KOR101.name: Elementary Korean I
KOR101.description: Designed for true beginners with little or no previous knowledge of the Korean language. Beginning-level speaking, listening comprehension, reading, writing, and grammar. Aspects of culture. Emphasis on accurate communication.

KOR102.name: Elementary Korean II
KOR102.description: Continuation of KOR 101. Further development of beginning-level proficiency in speaking, listening, reading, and writing. Additional aspect of culture. Continued emphasis on accurate communication.

KOR201.name: Intermediate Korean I
KOR201.description: Intermediate level proficiencies in speaking, listening, writing and reading. Aspects of Korean culture. Emphasis on accurate communication.

KOR202.name: Intermediate Korean II
KOR202.description: Continuation of KOR 201. Intermediate level proficiencies in speaking, listening, writing and reading. Aspects of Korean culture. Emphasis on accurate communication.

KOR290.name: Independent Study
KOR290.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
KOR290.description: Special projects in Korean arranged by an individual student and a faculty member in areas supplementing regular course offerings.

KOR291.name: Intermediate Topics in Korean Studies
KOR291.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
KOR291.description: Special topics supplementing regular course offerings. Focuses on particular aspects and topics of Korean language and culture.

KOR301.name: Intermediate-High Korean I
KOR301.description: Intermediate-mid level proficiencies in speaking, listening, writing and reading. Use of authentic materials, both spoken and written. Aspects of culture. Class conducted in Korean. Course is taught in Korean.

KOR302.name: Intermediate-High Korean II
KOR302.description: Intermediate-high level proficiencies in speaking, listening, writing and reading. Use of authentic materials, both spoken and written. Aspects of culture. Class conducted in Korean. Course is taught in Korean.

KOR401.name: Advanced Korean I
KOR401.description: Advanced level proficiencies in speaking, listening, writing and reading using authentic materials. Exploring aspects of culture. Class conducted entirely in Korean.

KOR402.name: Advanced Korean II
KOR402.description: Continuation of KOR 401. Advanced level proficiencies in speaking, listening, writing and reading using authentic materials. Exploring aspects of culture. Class conducted entirely in Korean.

KOR490.name: Independent Study
KOR490.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
KOR490.description: Special projects in Korean arranged by an individual student and a faculty member in areas supplementing regular course offerings.

KOR491.name: Advanced Topics in Korean Studies
KOR491.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
KOR491.description: Special topics supplementing regular course offerings. Focuses on particular aspects and topics of Korean language and culture.
